parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2oa </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.62</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Multiplayer </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>



</value></part><part><name>serverExec</name>=<value> server</value></part><part><name/>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> From server machine, change the ownership of an object to a given client. Returns [[true]] if locality was changed.<br>
Since Arma 3 v1.40, this command should not be used to transfer ownership of units with AI ([[agents]] are an exception to this rule). 
Using command in an unintended way will log a message to .rpt file.<br>
To transfer ownership of all AI units in a group properly, use [[setGroupOwner]] instead.

</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object '''setOwner''' clientID </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]] - </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> clientID: [[Number]] - the [[Multiplayer_Scripting#Machine_network_ID | machine network ID]] of the new [[owner]]. </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_someObject [[setOwner]] 12;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_someObject [[setOwner]] ([[owner]] _playerObject);</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[owner]], [[setGroupOwner]], [[groupOwner]], [[didJIPOwner]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 7, 2015 - 18:28 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
The ownership can only be given from server to client. For some reason the server cannot return ownership back with this command. This is fixed in Arma 3 1.40
</dd>
</dl>
<dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 22, 2017 - 18:56 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Demellion|Demellion]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
'''NOTE''': There are some interesting behaviour about the specific owner digits like '''0''' '''-2''' and '''2''': <br>
1. Any mission objects (generated from SQM) initially have '''0''' owner state, but it is not [[local]] to ANYONE (0) like it is expected to be, but actually only to a SERVER (2). You can't make any object owner to be 0 once it was changed. <br>
2. Trying to change ownership to any negative digit will always result in attempt to transfer ownership to SERVER (2). Once it is unit (non-agent) it will fail and revert* to initial ownership.<br>
3. *Changing ownership of a unit (non-agent) actually gives a result for a brief time after this action is performed. What actually happens next - ownership is getting reverted with a message to RPT of a server. This can be seen by reading results of (owner _object) in really fast cycle.   
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes -->
</comment>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on February 12, 2019 - 01:15 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:jonpas|jonpas]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Prints RPT warning "setGroupOwner should be used" as soon as there is one unit inside the vehicle, but performs the action successfully.
</dd>
</dl>
